instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a sometimes black screen
threads.message:
Hi!

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board that sometimes does not boot, i have black screen and the white led stays always on,
but when the system boots is stable for an entire day!

What you suggest to check?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a sometimes black screen
threads.message:
"sometimes does not boot, i have black screen and the white led stays always on"
No other sign, like chime, or USB activity then?

First check resistance to ground at 3V42 power rail, in ohm mode.
You should get more than 30K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a sometimes black screen
threads.message:
No, when it doesn't boot i only have the fan spinning: no chime, no video.
5.05v on usb ports.

Sure, i'll check 3V42 rail later.

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a sometimes black screen
threads.message:
Aaah, so the board starts always.
But sometime stays on without any activity.
Be sure no USB activity that moment.
Use USB OSX pendrive with LED link, to be sure; disconnect internal HDD.
Check if CPU gets voltage and see if drops a bit after few seconds.
Clean RAM slots and check one memory module at a time, each slot by separate.
